intro: Ardisia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and evergreens. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. After flowering, it produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds. These berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for wildlife.
